name: RunSqlCmdScriptsInFolderTask
friendlyName: Run all SQL Scripts in folder in SQLCMD mode
description: Run a multiple SQL Scripts in SQLCMD mode passing multiple parameters via a SqlCmdVariables array
author: Dr. John Tunnicliffe

inputs.name: Server
inputs.label: Server name or IP address
inputs.helpMarkDown: Server name or IP address.  Include the database instance name and port if necessary (e.g. myserver\myinstance,myport)

inputs.name: Database
inputs.label: The name of the SQL database
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the database against which the script will be run

inputs.name: SqlCmdSciptFolderPath
inputs.label: Path to folder containing SQLCMD script files
inputs.helpMarkDown: Path to the folder containing the SQLCMD scripts to be run.

inputs.name: Recursive
inputs.label: Recurse sub-folders and run all SQLCMD scipts found
inputs.helpMarkDown: Run SQLCMD scipts in the folder and all sub-folders in alphabetical order.

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariableType
inputs.label: Provide SQLCMD Variables
inputs.helpMarkDown: Choose how you wish to provide SQLCMD Variables to the script.

options.text: Multi-line text input as name/value pairs

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariablesInJson
inputs.label: SqlCmd Variables and Values (JSON format)
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of SqlCmd variables and their values in JSON format.

inputs.name: SqlCmdVariablesInText
inputs.label: SqlCmd Variables and Values (name/value pair format)
inputs.helpMarkDown:
A list of SqlCmd variables and their values in the format var=varvalue. e.g. 
var1='varvalue1'
var2='varvalue2'
var3='varvalue3'
var4='varvalue4'

inputs.name: AuthenticationMethod
inputs.label: Authentication Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: How to authenticate with the SQL Server database.

inputs.name: Username
inputs.label: The SQL Server Authentication Login ID for the SQL database
inputs.helpMarkDown: The login ID for making a SQL Server Authentication connection to an instance of the Database Engine

inputs.name: Password
inputs.label: The SQL Server Authentication Password for the SQL database Login ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specifies the password for the SQL Server Authentication login ID that was specified in the Username parameter. Please use a secured variable in this field.
